Also, call the native2ascii test *after* the build task, rather than as a dependency. But anyway, you see this bug if you try to invoke emacs kill line on the last line of the buffer, and your caret appears before 1 or more whitespace.

Some users prefer to have a constant filter and   they would like to synchronize only the directory. These users should   set search.dontSyncFilter to true. I introduced it as a hidden setting   (no gui), but I hope there will be an agreement for the gui also.

862aa67,k_satoda@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2012-06-27 14:06:58 +0000,Dropped the artificial limitation to 1024 chars on expanding the gap in ContentManager. Now it always use the complete remaining buffer which is expanded in a geometric progression. This change greatly speeds up big search&replace-all operations in which case copying in moveGapEnd() exhibited quadratic operation. Now it is amortized linear. (Patch #3533838 by Thomas Meyer, tweaked by me)
acb97ed,k_satoda@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2012-06-27 13:53:47 +0000,Avoided unreasonable memory consumption by duplicate String instances that could be allocated for each occurrence in a big search&replace-all. (Patch #3528619 by Thomas Meyer)

9f91131,k_satoda@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2012-06-17 05:47:47 +0000,Removed redundant hashCode field from UndoManager.RemovedContent. It seemed a workaround for a performance problem in a very old JVM implementation. Now, java.lang.String can cache its hash code in it, and major JVM implementations do that since over a decade ago. (SF.net patch #3531538)

84ba775,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2011-07-23 12:28:03 +0000,Antoher bug fix
9596686,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2011-07-23 12:25:19 +0000,Added a bug fix
a17dc0e,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2011-07-23 12:22:01 +0000,Avoid a deadlock when multiple files are dragged into jEdit. The problem was that the transfer handler invoked multiple "jEdit.openFile" in worker threads. jEdit.openFile takes the bufferListLock during the loading, and eventually needs to send an EditBus message on the EDT. If the EDT somehow needs the bufferListLock (e.g. saving the perspective) during this loading, there's a deadlock: The EDT waits for the work thread to release the bufferListLock, and the work thread is waiting for the EDT (to send the EditBus message). The current fix is simply to run jEdit.openFile in the EDT.
a6f6846,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2011-07-23 11:26:51 +0000,Fixed bug #3374207: Wrong mode detection on drag and drop from GNOME Commander The problem was that gnome-commander adds a trailing 0-byte after the file name. This extra 0-byte caused the filename regexp of the mode to not match the filename.

6fc034a,k_satoda@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2010-03-19 19:04:31 +0000,Fixed leaky memory usage after some specific operations on textArea.
c81fb77,daleanson@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2010-03-18 04:42:11 +0000,Adjusted the ModeProvider so it is a little smarter in picking the mode for a file. It is possible for a file to match more than one mode. Previously, the first mode that would accept the file was selected as the mode for the file. This change checks a little more, so a mode that matches both the filename glob and the first line glob will be selected before a mode that matches only the filename glob. If no mode matches both filename glob and first line glob, then a mode that matches the filename glob will be selected before a mode that only matches the first line glob. This is particularly useful for xml files, so that Ant build files can be differentiated from jEdit actions.xml files and from regular xml files.  Regardless of file name or first line globs, user modes will be selected before global modes.
0fc67b5,daleanson@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2010-03-18 04:22:30 +0000,The documentation for how to write an edit mode says that "if an edit mode in the user-specific catalog has the same name as an edit mode in the system catalog, the version in the user-specific catalog will override the system default."  This change makes this statement true.

756cea5,elberry@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2010-02-08 02:23:52 +0000,Adding version check to "Create Plugin Announcement" macro. This will show a warning to users creating a plugin release announcment when their plugin's requirements for jEdit, and other plugins don't match what they have installed. Eg. If the user is creating a plugin ann. for a plugin requiring jEdit 04.03.18.00, and they are running jEdit 04.03.99.01, the warning will show. Likewise, if the user creates an ann. for a plugin that requires ProjectViewer 2.9.0, but they are using 2.9.3 the warning will show. User's can always click "Yes", or hit enter on the dialog window to create the ann. anyway.

a0f5b62,ezust@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2010-01-02 08:11:11 +0000,Updated changelog.
d323a1b,daleanson@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2010-01-01 19:33:37 +0000,Fix for 2924261, BufferLocal ignores request to change encoding.  The problem isn't that BufferLocal ignores the request, the problem is that the encoding property is never set on the buffer before it is closed, so BufferLocal is never notified that the user wanted it changed.  This change sets the encoding prior to closing the buffer, so the proper EditBus message is generated, so BufferLocal is notified.

e800055,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-12-27 23:48:21 +0000,Fixed the build of the independent text area, which was broken when I added support for undo-aware plugins. Some jEdit-internal undo classes were referenced in JEditBuffer and broke the build. I moved the related code from JEditBuffer to Buffer, leaving empty methods in JEditBuffer for the undo/redo listeners.
4ae6ba1,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-12-27 23:24:02 +0000,Added configurable selection foreground color, which can be selected using Global Options -> Text Area. By default, the selection foreground color is disabled, which means that the foreground of the underlying token (from syntax highlighting) is used, as it always has been. The foreground color is only used when you select the check-box in the option pane.

30e971a,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-12-02 21:09:17 +0000,Fixed bug #2907139: Upgrading from 4.2final to 4.3pre18 causes freeze at startup The freeze was caused by an NPE while restoring the view's split configuration, because the buffersets feature changed both the format of the split config string and also created a new section in the perspective file for the specification of the buffers to open on startup. The new section does not exist in old perspective files, so the buffers are not opened automatically before reading the split config, and restoring the split config expected them to be open (with the buffersets feature).

3590505,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-10-03 13:37:43 +0000,TokenMarker.markTokens should be synchronized, as it is used (indirectly, from Buffer.markTokens) by various plugins as well, such as SyntaxHelper and TaskList. This method changes the 'context' field, and if not synchronized, a plugin can change the 'context' of the buffer's token marker in the middle of the usual token marking of the core.
7a34eec,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-10-03 06:29:29 +0000,Started fixing issues reported by FindBugs. EditServer & TipOfTheDay: Random().nextInt() can return Integer.MIN_VALUE, in which case "Math.abs()" retains the negative value. BufferChanging: getStackTrace().toString() returns the string representation of the stack trace object itself, which is not human-understandable (it is mostly a handle number). To get the string representation of the stack trace elements, need to use Arrays.toString(getStackTrace()).

05c5ec6,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-09-01 05:52:12 +0000,A small performance fix for patch #2846169 (Allow blank lines at beginning of fold in indent folding mode): There is no need to ask for preceding fold levels for each line of the range whose fold levels are being computed, only for the first line of that range.
922b1ee,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-08-31 21:25:44 +0000,Documented recent changes.
511f5d4,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-08-31 21:07:15 +0000,Fix for patch #2846169: IndentFoldHandler - allow blank lines after start of fold The previous patch did not work correctly, because the folding code in jEdit assumed that a content change in a line cannot affect the fold levels of the preceding lines. Hence, it did not recalculate the fold levels of the preceding lines, and did not update the fold markers accordingly. The patch for the indent folding mode gives whitespace-only lines the same fold level as the first non-whitespace-only line following them, so it breaks this assumption, since a change to a line can affect the fold level of preceding whitespace-only lines. This commit fixes the assumption by adding a new method to the fold handler for returning the fold levels of preceding lines. Whenever the fold level of a line is changed, this new method is called and the fold levels of the preceding lines get updated correctly. By default, this method does not return anything so no overhead (almost) is added.
bec6a8d,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-08-30 23:06:46 +0000,Applied a modified version of patch #2846169: IndentFoldHandler - allow blank lines after start of fold. The change is to try to take the fold level of whitespace-only lines from the next non-whitespace line, so that empty lines at the beginning of a fold are considered part of the fold. The modification from the patch is that the recursion has been replaced with an iterator.

b73d93b,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-07-15 21:21:30 +0000,Attempt to fix bug #2817321: Exception on startup. This bug was caused by a back-incompatibility introduced by BufferSets. Previously, the perspective.xml file specified the split configuration by means of buffers (there was a single global buffer-set, shared by all edit panes). BufferSets changed the format of the split configuration to include a specification of buffer-sets, and the split is now specified by means of buffer-sets.
1097615,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-07-11 06:46:33 +0000,Fixed bug #2819701: DockableWindowManagerImpl causes NullPointerExceptions The classic dockable window manager sent DockableWindowUpdate edit bus messages with a null dockable name.
ce931ba,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-07-10 08:40:35 +0000,Hopefully fixed the restoring of views from the saved perspective for dual-monitor environments. A previous bug fix I made was meant to solve the case where a user moves from a dual-monitor setup to a single monitor setup, with the same settings directory, in which case if a view was previously on the second monitor, its startup location will be outside the single monitor, thus it won't be on the screen. My previous fix used GraphicsEnvironment.getMaximumScreenBounds, which only returns the bounds of the current display. For dual-monitor setups, this is not sufficient, need to iterate all the devices to find the bounds.

1f0ebc9,ezust@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-04-13 05:24:50 +0000,setDirty() should check isUntitled, not isNew, for the suppressConfirm option on untitled buffers.
8d912c1,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-04-12 19:58:23 +0000,Fixed my previous *incorrect* fix for #2744708. If the underlying file of a buffer is deleted, the buffer should be marked both "new" and "dirty". Marking it dirty sends the BufferUpdate.DIRTY_CHANGED edit bus message if needed, and this notifies BufferTabs and the buffer switcher that the buffer status changed so they can update their icons. The current change fixes an earlier *incorrect* fix that was meant to change only the MD5 calculation in this case but unintentionally prevented the buffer from being marked dirty.
da20fc9,ezust@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-04-12 15:49:33 +0000,Removed deprecated CaretChanging class. Use PositionChanging class instead. Also improved some API docs in EditPaneUpdate.

618f570,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-04-09 18:59:22 +0000,Fixed two bugs I inserted as part of the fix for copying indentation string from previous line: 1. If there is no none-empty previous line, create an indentation string according to the options. 2. If the ideal indentation is the same as the current one, do not change the indentation string, and return false from indentLine. This enables <tab> presses to work, which were previously ignored because of the indentation.

6d45f4b,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-04-02 17:03:22 +0000,Fixed bug #2609091: Windows appear out of view When loading the view location and size from perspective.xml, check that the view bounds are inside the screen, and if not, fix them. Such cases can happen, for example, if a user worked in a dual monitor environment, where the view was in the 2nd monitor, and then restarted jEdit in a single monitor environment. The coordinates of the view in this case will be outside the single monitor boundaries, and the view will be hidden if not corrected.

a6f748a,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-03-27 12:51:18 +0000,Fixed the handling of "single interval" selection mode in the filtered list model. In this mode, any call to "setSelectionInterval" removes all previous selections, keeping only the current one. Using "setSelectionInterval" for each item thus leaves only the last item selected.
de96c40,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-03-26 22:12:55 +0000,Documented fix for Out Of Bounds exception in FilteredListModel.
95c52bb,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-03-26 22:10:50 +0000,Fixed bug #2712031: Index out of bounds exception in FilteredListModel The list selection is saved at the beginning of setFilter, in order to restore it after changing the list (by filtering). But the selection isn't explicitly cleared, so in case the items selected were filtered out, the selection won't be changed, leading to selection of non-existent indices.

e3e3753,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-03-20 14:22:21 +0000,Fixed names of properties which specify what elements to include in full-screen mode.
9ab7c1e,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2009-03-20 14:08:15 +0000,(Hopefully) Fixed bug #2671628: perspective.xml not saved on exit The startupDone vector is used to find out when all views have been laid out. The DockableLayoutSetter class is used to defer layout of all views loaded from perspective.xml to the AWT thread. Each instance lays out a different view, and marks in the startupDone vector when done. This was done in order to eliminate false dependencies between the various setters, but the index provided to each layout setter was based on the view count, which, in rare situations may be incorrect. Changed the index to use the number of items in the startupDone vector, protecting it with "synchronized" to ensure no two instances get the same index.

db4039d,daleanson@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-11-18 04:58:22 +0000,Fix for bug 1968223, "wrong mouse pointer in view 1". Calling visit(SetCursorVisitor) sets the cursor on the editPane, and setting the text cursor on the editPane is incorrect since this will cause the text cursor to be set on the bufferswitcher, and the gutter and scrollbars of the text area.  Using the default cursor is the right thing to do, this will set the proper cursor on the subcomponents.

02fb88b,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-10-17 06:50:06 +0000,Fixed bug #2173087: regex '$' does not replace an empty last line. The problem was with the matching of the last line, it doesn't really exist and should not match. The fix: Stop matching when we've reached the end offset.
923e790,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-10-17 06:23:32 +0000,Fixed bug #2173091: regex hypersearch '^' only matches the first line. This was caused by '^' matching the empty string at the beginning of the buffer, causing the next match to begin at the same offset, without increasing it first.
2fade7b,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-10-17 04:45:12 +0000,Fixed bug #2173112: Search within selection of regexp '$' does not match the last line. This was caused by an exception - if the last selection line is empty, buffer.getSegment() was called with a negative length of -1. Also removed an unused variable.

b9470f4,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-08-16 21:10:03 +0000,Show a choice dialog for loading a saved layout.
b812839,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-08-16 20:34:48 +0000,Removed the association between a view's persistence in perspective.xml and its layout file. The layout file is produced and read by the docking framework for each view according to the view index, removing the need for an association in the perspective file. This way, when the docking framework is switched, we can use the previous layout file that was created for the view by the framework to which we switched. Also, the saving and loading of named layouts no longer requires a perspective file in a separate directory; only the framework directory is needed. The list of named layouts to create dynamic actions for is now taken from the framework, ensure that we don't create dynamic actions for layouts saved in other frameworks.

0f7902a,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-08-11 11:11:24 +0000,Added a notification to the docking framework when the "alternate layout" is changed from Global Options -> View.
8dd08a3,shlomy@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-08-10 20:54:46 +0000,Merging my docking_framework branch back into the main trunk. This adds a few new features to the jEdit core: 1. A pluggable docking framework, which can be provided as a service by plugins. To choose the docking framework, use Global Options -> Docking. The original jEdit dockable window manager is named 'Original'. If you get the MyDoggyPlugin plugin, you can select between Original and MyDoggy. 2. Named perspectives - you can now save the docking layout in a file, and load it any time later from a file. Also, once you save the layout in a file, you get an action that loads the layout from this file, and you can bind this action to a keyboard shortcut or toolbar button just like any other action. The actions to load/save the layout are available through the View->Docking menu, and the action set for keyboard shortcuts or toolbar buttons is named "Docking layouts" (in Global Options dialog). 3. Mode-specific perspectives - you can associate the docking layout with an edit mode, each edit mode having its own layout. You can have jEdit automatically save the layout of an edit mode when you switch to another, and automatically load the layout of an edit mode when you enter the mode. The auto load/save of mode-specific layout can be set using Global Options -> Docking.

cd5ac2e,vanza@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2008-05-01 04:47:58 +0000,Minimize the creation of new string instances when processing data from the buffer. New strings require copies of the data to be made - the new approach uses a CharSequence implementation that provides most of the same functions as a String, but is backed by the same data used internally by the buffer - so no copying.

58cc344,ezust@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2007-06-28 21:26:56 +0000,Documented the use of newly added (re) prefix to disable translation into globs.
4d2fc38,Vampire0@6b1eeb88-9816-0410-afa2-b43733a0f04e,2007-06-28 16:33:20 +0000,Glob translation to regexes got a new feature. If you start a glob now with the sequence "(re)" this prefix is discarded and the remaining string is interpreted unchanged as regex. If you need a glob starting with "(re)" you have to escape it and write "\(re)" instead. So now you can use EVERYWHERE a glob is expected a normal regex instead and use their full power.
